Walmart.title: (USA) Senior Director, Marketing Planning and Strategy- Marketplace & Consumables
Walmart.description:
**Position Summary...**
-----------------------


As Senior Director, Marketing Planning and Strategy, you and your team will lead the development and execution of Walmart’s marketing strategy for two critical business units of Marketplace and Consumables, driving incremental GMV, consideration, and engagement. This high\-impact role will shape the strategic marketing roadmap, guide cross\-functional planning, and ensure effective activation with enterprise priorities, including the Customer Value Proposition (CVP) initiative. You will operate at the intersection of marketing, analytics, business strategy, and execution—delivering measurable results and elevating Walmart’s brand relevance.  

  

About the Team  

  

The Marketing Planning \& Strategy team translates Walmart’s business goals and customer data and insights into actionable marketing strategies and plans. We collaborate across the company—including Merchandising, eCommerce, Finance and within Marketing —to develop integrated strategies that drive customer relevance and business value. Our work is insight\-driven, outcome\-focused, creative and break through. Through our work, we bring commerce and culture together to change our customers beliefs and behaviors on Walmart.**What you'll do...**
---------------------

* Lead marketing strategy for Marketplace \& Consumables: Partner with EVP and SVP leaders and build and execute long\-term marketing plans aligned to Walmart’s growth priorities, leveraging customer insights, market trends, and P\&L understanding to inform strategy.
* Drive integrated planning across CVP initiative: Partner with leaders and cross\-functional teams across Merchandising, Site, and eComm to develop cohesive marketing strategies and actions to deliver this enterprise initiative.
* Guide performance optimization: Use data and analytics to evaluate marketing effectiveness, identify opportunities, and refine strategies for greater impact.
* Support customer growth and retention: Develop initiatives that enhance engagement, loyalty, and lifetime value for Marketplace and Consumables customers.
* Manage executive communications: Present strategic plans and performance updates, results to senior business leadership and key stakeholders.
* Enable cross\-functional execution: Align teams to ensure seamless delivery of marketing programs.
* Build and lead a high\-performing team: Lead a team of 5 (with potential expansion to 7\-8\), including directors, senior managers and managers. Recruit, develop, and mentor talent in marketing strategy, planning, and analytics.


**Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)**
* Understand key metrics for each business unit and respective marketing campaigns, and initiatives, with a focus on ROI and incremental growth.
* Understand and deliver measurable improvements in campaign performance and return on investment leveraging data and analytics and measurement models including MMM, ROAS, LTA, MTA.
* Strategic Alignment – Ensure marketing plans align with enterprise priorities, SBU, customer and business outcomes.


**What You’ll Bring**
* 15\+ years of experience in marketing strategy, planning, or retail roles, ideally within large\-scale consumer or retail organizations.
* Proven ability to lead cross\-functional planning and deliver marketing strategies with significant business impact.
* Strong analytical and financial acumen, including experience with P\&Ls, ROI modeling, data, insights \& analysis, and performance measurement.
* Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills, including experience influencing without direct authority and presenting to executive leadership.
* Ability to thrive in a fast\-paced, matrixed environment and lead complex initiatives with multiple stakeholders.
* Experience in retail and consumer products; Marketplace and eCommerce expertise strongly preferred.
* Commitment to building inclusive, high\-performance teams and developing future leaders.
* Soft skills: Positive spirt and energy, servant leadership, resilience, curiosity, urgency, speed, and adaptability.


At Walmart, we offer competitive pay as well as performance\-based bonus awards and other great benefits for a happier mind, body, and wallet. Health benefits include medical, vision and dental coverage. Financial benefits include 401(k), stock purchase and company\-paid life insurance. Paid time off benefits include PTO (including sick leave), parental leave, family care leave, bereavement, jury duty, and voting. Other benefits include short\-term and long\-term disability, company discounts, Military Leave Pay, adoption and surrogacy expense reimbursement, and more. You will also receive PTO and/or PPTO that can be used for vacation, sick leave, holidays, or other purposes. The amount you receive depends on your job classification and length of employment. It will meet or exceed the requirements of paid sick leave laws, where applicable. For information about PTO, see https://one.walmart.com/notices. Live Better U is a Walmart\-paid education benefit program for full\-time and part\-time associates in Walmart and Sam's Club facilities. Programs range from high school completion to bachelor's degrees, including English Language Learning and short\-form certificates. Tuition, books, and fees are completely paid for by Walmart.
  

Eligibility requirements apply to some benefits and may depend on your job classification and length of employment. Benefits are subject to change and may be subject to a specific plan or program terms.
  

For information about benefits and eligibility, see One.Walmart.
  

The annual salary range for this position is $130,000\.00 \- $260,000\.00 Additional compensation includes annual or quarterly performance bonuses. Additional compensation for certain positions may also include :
  

* Stock

experience in marketing or related field.

Walmart.title: Realty Project Coach
Walmart.description:
**Position Summary...**
-----------------------

**What you'll do...**
---------------------


As a Realty Project Coach, you'll join our Realty Execution team and you'll take the ownership in delivering store remodels, ensuring they're done on time, within budget, and meet our top\-notch quality standards. In this role, you'll supervise hourly team members, handle any escalations, and collaborate with store associates to keep everything on track. Plus, you'll embrace the travel that comes with the job.


Walmart truly stands out as the best place to build a career from the ground up. No other company can rival our combination of making a massive impact and our culture of promoting from within, from entry\-level roles all the way to executive positions. Thanks to our unique mix of career pathways, perks, and pay, you can craft just about any career you dream of here, no matter where you start or what you aspire to achieve.

**Why You'll Love This Role:**

* **Leading Others:** Motivate your team to meet timelines and deliverables on projects. Encourage collaboration and teamwork among associates. Reinforce what teamwork looks like by resolving store leadership, supplier, and associate concerns.
* **Project Ownership:** Own the execution of projects in your assigned stores. Communicate plans, changes, and obstacles to key stakeholders. Understand plans and minimize impact on store operations.
* **Develop Associates:** Provide supervision and development opportunities for your team members. Spend time listening and acting on ideas, suggestions, questions, or concerns. Evaluate talent, train and mentor, provide recognition, and identify career paths for associates.

**Your Resume Will Stand Out With:**

* Demonstrated knowledge of construction remodels, project management, space management, and/or store design.
* Experience with leading people, projects, initiatives, or leading cross\-functional teams.

**Shift:** Primarily working overnights; night shifts average from 10 to 12 hours.

**Travel:** Frequent travel up to 1000 miles from home is a role requirement. Expect to be away from home 80% of the time, or for 17\-21 days at a time. Travel areas are based on project workload and will change as the business needs. Associate will be based out of a home store but can expect to travel to surrounding states or farther to support projects. Mileage will be reimbursed, and overnight stays will be paid for Realty Project Coach roles. Time traveling is not paid.

**Salary:** The annual salary range for this position is $60,000 \- $110,000\.

**Minimum Qualifications:**

* Bachelor's degree in business or related field and 1 year of experience in project management, space management, store design, operations, data analysis, or related area OR 3 years of experience in project management, space management, store design, operations, data analysis, or related area.

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Master’s degree in Business or related field.
* 1 year’s experience leading cross\-functional teams.
* Project Management \- Management Professional Certification.

**Additional Information:**

* Have reliable transportation.
* Provide supervision and development opportunities for associates by hiring and training; mentoring; assigning duties; providing recognition; and ensuring diversity awareness.
* Ensure compliance with company policies and procedures and supports company mission, values, and standards of ethics and integrity by implementing related action plans; utilizing and supporting the Open\-Door Policy; and providing direction and guidance on applying these in executing business processes and practices.
* Provide and support the implementation of business solutions by building relationships and partnerships with key stakeholders; identifying business needs; determining and carrying out necessary processes and practices; monitoring progress and results; recognizing and capitalizing on improvement opportunities; and adapting to competing demands, organizational changes, and new responsibilities

Walmart.title: Director, Software Engineering
Walmart.description:
**Position Summary...**
-----------------------

**What you'll do...**
---------------------


**Walmart** is a multi\-national, people\-led, tech\-powered omnichannel retailer with over 2\.2 million associates. At **CCaaS** **Platform**, we’re at the forefront of designing and deploying Walmart’s next\-generation Contact Center as a Service (CCaaS) platform. Our mission is to support all business functions while leveraging state\-of\-the\-art AI and GenAI capabilities to enhance agent experience and productivity, empower customers with self\-service options, and reduce average handle time in client\-agent interactions.
We are seeking a hands\-on highly skilled and experienced **Director of****Software Engineer** to join our team. In this people leadership role, you will report directly to the Sr. Director of Engineering and GenAI. You will be responsible for leading a talented team of Sr. Managers, Software Engineers and Data Scientists developing the multi\-tenant Contact Center Platform and the innovative Machine Learning and Generative AI systems, as well as architecting enterprise\-grade microservices, and pipelines.
**What** **you'll** **do:**
As a director, you will be instrumental in defining the technical vision and architecture of systems, ensuring they meet performance, security, and scalability requirements. You will collaborate with cross\-functional teams, guide engineering efforts, and lead the adoption of cutting\-edge technologies to build reliable, high\-quality platform software solutions. You will own attracting, developing, and growing top engineering talent while fostering a culture of innovation and high performance.

* Build, develop and guide high\-performing talent. Define a long\-term talent strategy cutting across technology. Provide supervision, mentoring and development opportunities for the team who report into you.
* Provide guidance in applying the right architectural pattern for the modernization of the applications by analyzing the gaps between existing architecture and new business requirements
* Drive automation using more adoption and CI/CD maturity
* Drive implementation of telemetry features based on the domain requirements to improve the overall operational excellence of the application
* Technical leadership in building a complex microservices based platform or product that are highly reliable, and scalable
* Drive technical impact analysis, conduct RCAs with corrective actions for both short; long term fixes and prevent them from reoccurring
* Operating with excellence Set an example in managing to KPIs, delivering excellence, presenting at all levels, and developing yourself and others
* Analyze system performance impacting the complete product for non\-functional requirements like reliability, operability, performance efficiency and security
* Develops and implements strategies to attract and maintain a highly skilled and engaged workforce by diagnosing capability gaps; recruiting, selecting, and developing talent; supporting mentorship, workforce development, and succession planning; and leveraging the capabilities of new and existing talent

**What** **you'll** **bring:**
* Bachelor's degree in computer science, computer engineering, computer information systems, software engineering, or related area and 15\+ years’ experience in software engineering or related area.
* Deep working knowledge of all aspects of Cloud native distributed system development: Azure/ GCP/ WCNP preferred
* Experience working with micro\-services architecture and distributed systems.
* Experience managing software development engineers, leaders, architects and leading engineering projects, guiding engineering teams on engineering excellence; solid system design
* Experience partnering with cross\-functional project development and in collaborating with other scrum teams, QA, Release Management, Program Management, and TechOps
* Proven experience in the design, development, and scaling of software platforms for large user bases, focusing on modularity and extensibility.

* Platform\-focused decision\-making, balancing technical and business needs in fast\-paced, complex environments to ensure performance and scalability.
* Experience collaborating with geographically distributed teams to align on platform goals.
* Strong business acumen, integrating technical vision with strategic business insights.
At Walmart, we offer competitive pay as well as performance\-based bonus awards and other great benefits for a happier mind, body, and wallet. Health benefits include medical, vision and dental coverage. Financial benefits include 401(k), stock purchase and company\-paid life insurance. Paid time off benefits include PTO (including sick leave), parental leave, family care leave, bereavement, jury duty, and voting. Other benefits include short\-term and long\-term disability, company discounts, Military Leave Pay, adoption and surrogacy expense reimbursement, and more. You will also receive PTO and/or PPTO that can be used for vacation, sick leave, holidays, or other purposes. The amount you receive depends on your job classification and length of employment. It will meet or exceed the requirements of paid sick leave laws, where applicable. For information about PTO, see https://one.walmart.com/notices. Live Better U is a Walmart\-paid education benefit program for full\-time and part\-time associates in Walmart and Sam's Club facilities. Programs range from high school completion to bachelor's degrees, including English Language Learning and short\-form certificates. Tuition, books, and fees are completely paid for by Walmart.
  

Eligibility requirements apply to some benefits and may depend on your job classification and length of employment. Benefits are subject to change and may be subject to a specific plan or program terms.
  

For information about benefits and eligibility, see One.Walmart.
  

The annual salary range for this position is $169,000\.00 \- $338,000\.00 Additional compensation includes annual or quarterly performance bonuses. Additional compensation for certain positions may also include :
  

* Stock


ㅤ


ㅤ


ㅤ


ㅤ


‎

**Minimum Qualifications...**
-----------------------------

*Outlined below are the required minimum qualifications for this position. If none are listed, there are no minimum qualifications.*

Option 1: Bachelor's degree in computer science, computer engineering, computer information systems, software engineering, or related area and 6 years’ experience in software engineering or related area.  

Option 2: 8 years’ experience in software engineering or related area.  

3 years' supervisory experience.**Preferred Qualifications...**
-------------------------------

-----------------------

Walmart.description:
**Position Summary...**
-----------------------

**What you'll do...**
---------------------


The Executive Assistant will provide high\-level administrative support to the **Vice President of Health \& Wellness (H\&W) Growth \& Partnerships and the Vice President of Health \& Wellness, Optical Lead.** You’ll play a key role in facilitating communications, managing schedules, and organizing critical information. We are seeking an Executive Assistant to be based out of our Bentonville, AR campus. The successful candidate will be a collaborative team member with a friendly work style, exceptionally well\-organized, able to effectively prioritize, and take initiative with projects. **You will make an impact by…**
* Demonstrating a proactive ability to anticipate needs and changes, then react efficiently with independent judgment.
* Planning, managing, and executing large scale events and meetings.
* Establishing and fostering effective relationships with all levels of internal and external partners.
* Managing meetings, including editing/creating slide decks and broad communications, running conference line or webinar/video conference.
* Coordinating travel arrangements, both domestic and international (flights, hotel, train and car service, etc.)
* Balancing multiple tasks in support of numerous team members
* Solving problems effectively and creatively while maintaining a high level of professionalism and integrity.
* Preparing/submitting expense reports as needed through Concur system.
* Coordinate and capture agenda for key meetings including: Weekly Staff meeting, other ad hoc team meetings, Mentor meetings, etc.
* Team building: help with direct report team building events/activities
* Culture building: help with broader organization culture building (e.g., holiday fun, Birthday recognition, etc.


**You’ll sweep us off our feet if you have..**
* Advanced computer skills with MS Teams, OneNote, MS Office Suite
* MS PowerPoint presentations skills
* Experience with travel planning

Walmart.title: (USA) Senior Manager, Software Engineering
Walmart.description:
**Position Summary...**
-----------------------

**What you'll do...**
---------------------

**Senior Engineering Manager – Event Driven Fulfillment \& GeoDemand**  

Are you passionate about building scalable systems and leading high\-performing engineering teams? We’re looking for a **Senior Engineering Manager** to drive innovation and execution within our **Event Driven Fulfillment** and **GeoDemand** domains—key pillars of our next\-generation supply chain and inventory intelligence platforms.  

  

**What You’ll Do**
* **Engineering Excellence**: Champion best practices in software development, architecture, and operational reliability.
* **Smooth Execution**: Lead planning, prioritization, and coordination to ensure consistent delivery of high\-quality solutions.
* **Technical Leadership**: Collaborate with architects and product leaders to shape solutions that meet evolving business needs.
* **Talent Development**: Mentor engineers and foster a culture of ownership, innovation, and continuous learning.
* **Cross\-Functional Collaboration**: Partner with teams across Global Tech to align strategy, resolve dependencies, and accelerate delivery.
* **Operational Oversight**: Manage team health, capacity planning, and incident response to maintain service excellence.


  

**What You Bring**  

**Must\-Haves:**
* 10\+ years of experience with agile practices and leading efficient teams
* 5\+ years as a lead developer in highly scalable systems
* Strong technical acumen in both transactional and asynchronous paradigms
* 5\+ years of experience in operational and engineering excellence
* 5\+ years working with data pipeline or workflow technologies (e.g., Airflow, ETL toolsets)
* Excellent communication skills with the ability to convey complex technical topics to non\-technical stakeholders and senior leaders


  

**Nice\-to\-Haves:**
* Experience with Kafka
* Fullstack development background
* Familiarity with Grafana and Prometheus
* Hands\-on experience with CI/CD pipelines and DevOps automation

Walmart.title: Senior Analyst, Supply Chain Management
Walmart.description:
**Position Summary...**
-----------------------

**What you'll do...**
---------------------


As a part of the Walmart Supply Chain organization, you will contribute to the success of our Transportation Network! Why? Because Sam Walton founded our company with the belief that the customer is \#1\. It is not just a belief, but our way of doing business. With our Transportation Team at the forefront of retail transformation you can work on a team that is ultimately focused on delighting our customers, saving them both time and money in unexpected ways. As the biggest player in the game, we trust our associates to innovate the future of Supply Chain! This team is at the crossroads of operations and technology to optimize transportation shipments for the best cost and service. As a Senior Analyst, you'll be responsible for:
* Carrier Network Development and Management: Develop and steer a comprehensive network of reliable carriers, prioritizing efficient and cost\-effective freight movement.
* Rate Negotiation: Negotiate competitive rates with carriers to drive profitability, minimize cost, and exceed service requirements while exercising sound judgment and strategic thinking.
* Customer Service and Relationship Building: Provide exceptional service to both internal and external stakeholders, ensuring needs and expectations are consistently met or exceeded, and building strong relationships.
* Communication and Collaboration: Effectively communicate with drivers, customers, and internal teams through written and verbal means, ensuring timely updates and resolution of any issues, while fostering open collaboration.
* Problem\-solving and Decision\-making: Employ critical thinking and sound decision\-making skills to resolve operational problems and optimize carrier performance, demonstrating resourcefulness and adaptability.
* Continuous Improvement and Innovation: Embrace a customer\-centric mindset, identifying opportunities for process improvements and suggesting solutions to enhance operational efficiency, driving innovation and progress.


To succeed in this role, you should have:
* A background in transportation operations (\+2yrs) or bachelor’s degree
* Be a problem solver
* Be customer\-centric and enjoy building relationships
* Able to learn and adapt quickly and handle multiple projects at one time
* Excellent organizational and time management skills
* Ability to work in a fast\-paced environment
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills


You will wow us if you have:
* 5\+ years of experience logistics, supply chain management, brokerage, or a related field
* Advanced degree or certification in supply chain management or related field
* Carrier management experience

  

  

  

Respect the individual: Demonstrates and encourages respect for others drives a positive associate and customer/member experience for all embraces differences in people cultures ideas and experiences supports workplaces where associated feel seen and connected through a culture of belonging so all associates thrive and perform contributes to an environment allowing everyone to bring their best selves to work  

  

Respect the individual: Demonstrates engagement and commitment to the team developing others through feedback coaching mentoring and developmental opportunities and recognizes others contributions and accomplishments  

  

Respect the individual: Builds strong and trusting relationships with team members and business partners works collaboratively to achieve objectives communicates with impact and listens attentively to a range of audiences and demonstrates energy and positivity for own work  

  

Act with Integrity: Maintains and promotes the highest standards of integrity ethics and compliance models the Walmart values and leads by example to foster our culture supports Walmart's goal of becoming a regenerative company by making a positive impact for associates customers and the world around us e.g. creating a sense of belonging eliminating waste participating in local giving  

  

Act with Integrity: Follows the law our code of conduct and company policies and encourages others to do the same supports an environment where associates feel comfortable sharing concerns reinforces our culture of nonretaliation listens to concerns raised by associates and takes action acts with accountability for achieving results in a way that is consistent with our values  

  

Act with Integrity: Is consistently humble self aware honest and transparent  

  

Serve our Customers and Members. Delivers results while putting the customer/member first and applying an omnimerchant mindset and acts with an Every Day Low Cost mindset to drive value and Every Day Low Prices for customers/members.  

  

Serve our Customers and Members. Adopts a broad perspective that considers data analytics customer/member insights and different parts of the business when making plans  

  

Strive for Excellence: Consistently raises the bar and seeks to improve demonstrates curiosity and a growth mindset seeks feedback asks thoughtful questions supports innovation and intelligent risk taking and exhibits resilience in the face of setbacks  

  

Strive for Excellence: Implements and supports continuous improvements and willingly embraces new digital tools and ways of working At Walmart, we offer competitive pay as well as performance\-based bonus awards and other great benefits for a happier mind, body, and wallet. Walmart.title: Senior Manager, Technical Program Management
Walmart.description:
**Position Summary...**
-----------------------

**What you'll do...**
---------------------


At Walmart, we’re constantly building the technologies that power the world’s largest retail ecosystem — from supply chain automation and data platforms to next\-generation commerce and AI.
We’re seeking a **Senior Manager, Technology Strategy \& Partnerships** to connect the dots between what our engineers are building internally and the innovation happening externally in the market. In this role, you’ll work across engineering and product teams to **catalog the technology landscape within Walmart**, identify **strategic opportunities for partnerships or acquisitions**, and **source external companies** that can accelerate our roadmap. You’ll lead discovery and early diligence, coordinate the right technical and business stakeholders, and help bring new technologies from concept through **pilot and proof\-of\-concept execution**. This is a unique opportunity to sit at the intersection of **technology, strategy, and innovation**, shaping how Walmart builds and partners for the future.
**What You’ll Do:**  

**Map and Analyze Internal Technology Landscape*** Partner with engineering teams across Walmart Global Tech to catalog platforms, tools, and initiatives currently in development.
* Identify redundancies, synergies, and innovation gaps across lines of business.
* Build scalable processes and visibility tools for ongoing technology inventory tracking.

**Source and Evaluate External Innovation*** Scout emerging technologies and startups aligned to Walmart’s strategic priorities in retail tech, data, AI, automation, logistics, and customer experience.
* Build relationships with venture partners, accelerators, and industry networks to stay ahead of trends.
* Identify and qualify external companies for partnership or potential acquisition.

**Lead Early\-Stage Diligence and Pilots*** Conduct initial technical and strategic assessments of prospective partners.
* Collaborate with Walmart’s corporate development, product, and legal teams during the discovery and evaluation process.
* Coordinate cross\-functional teams to design and execute pilots or proofs of concept.
* Measure pilot outcomes and report insights back to technology and business leadership.

**Strategic Alignment \& Influence*** Connect internal innovation with external opportunities that advance Walmart’s long\-term technology strategy.
* Provide leadership with actionable insights on emerging trends, competitive movements, and partnership opportunities.
* Act as a strategic bridge between Global Tech, Corporate Development, and business units.


**What You’ll Bring:*** Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Business, or related field; MBA or advanced technical degree preferred.
* 5\+ years of experience in technology strategy, partnerships, corporate development, or product innovation roles.
* Strong understanding of enterprise\-scale technology systems, cloud architectures, and software development.
* Experience collaborating with technical and business leaders to evaluate and pilot new technologies.
* Excellent communication and relationship\-building skills — able to translate between engineering detail and strategic outcomes.
* A proactive, analytical, and curious mindset, with the ability to spot opportunities that drive real\-world impact.

**Preferred Experience*** Prior work in or with large\-scale technology organizations or innovation teams.
* Exposure to startup ecosystems, venture sourcing, or early\-stage partnerships.
* Familiarity with Walmart’s business domains (supply chain, retail operations, customer experience, or data/AI platforms).


  

**About Walmart Global Tech:**  

Imagine working in an environment where one line of code can make life easier for hundreds of millions of people. Thats what we do at Walmart Global Tech. Were a team of software engineers, data scientists, cybersecurity experts and service professionals within the worlds leading retailer who make an epic impact and are at the forefront of the next retail disruption. People are why we innovate, and people power our innovations. We are people\-led and tech\-empowered. We train our team in the skillsets of the future and bring in experts like you to help us grow. We have roles for those chasing their first opportunity as well as those looking for the opportunity that will define their career. Here, you can kickstart a great career in tech, gain new skills and experience for virtually every industry, or leverage your expertise to innovate at scale, impact millions and reimagine the future of retail.  

Walmart's culture is a competitive advantage, and its fostered by being together. Working together in person allows us to collaborate, align quickly and innovate with greater speed. We use our campuses to create purposeful connection rooted in deepening understanding and investing in the development of our associates.  

Our hubs: Walmart is a global company with offices across the United States and around the world. Our global headquarters is in Bentonville, Arkansas, with primary hubs in the San Francisco Bay area and New York/New Jersey.  

  

**Benefits:**  

Benefits: Beyond our great compensation package, you can receive incentive awards for your performance. Other great perks include 401(k) match, stock purchase plan, paid maternity and parental leave, PTO, multiple health plans, and much more.  

  

**Equal Opportunity Employer:**  

Walmart, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer – By Choice. We believe we are best equipped to help our associates, customers, and the communities we serve live better when we really know them. That means understanding, respecting, and valuing unique styles, experiences, identities, ideas, and opinions – while being inclusive of all people.  

  

*The above information has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed in the role. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all responsibilities and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job. The full Job Description can be made available as part of the hiring process.*  

  

At Walmart, we offer competitive pay as well as performance\-based bonus awards and other great benefits for a happier mind, body, and wallet. Health benefits include medical, vision and dental coverage. Financial benefits include 401(k), stock purchase and company\-paid life insurance. Paid time off benefits include PTO (including sick leave), parental leave, family care leave, bereavement, jury duty, and voting. Other benefits include short\-term and long\-term disability, company discounts, Military Leave Pay, adoption and surrogacy expense reimbursement, and more. You will also receive PTO and/or PPTO that can be used for vacation, sick leave, holidays, or other purposes. The amount you receive depends on your job classification and length of employment. It will meet or exceed the requirements of paid sick leave laws, where applicable. For information about PTO, see https://one.walmart.com/notices. Live Better U is a Walmart\-paid education benefit program for full\-time and part\-time associates in Walmart and Sam's Club facilities. Programs range from high school completion to bachelor's degrees, including English Language Learning and short\-form certificates. Tuition, books, and fees are completely paid for by Walmart.
  

Eligibility requirements apply to some benefits and may depend on your job classification and length of employment. Benefits are subject to change and may be subject to a specific plan or program terms.
  

For information about benefits and eligibility, see One.Walmart.
  

The annual salary range for this position is $110,000\.00 \- $220,000\.00 Additional compensation includes annual or quarterly performance bonuses. Additional compensation for certain positions may also include :
  

* Stock

* Option 2: 8 years’ experience in engineering, engineering program management, technical program management, product management, or related area.

Walmart.title: Director, Public and Government Affairs
Walmart.description:
**Position Summary...**
-----------------------


Job Description Summary:  

The Policy Director is a highly skilled, experienced professional responsible for advising Walmart, Inc., and its leadership on public policy issues at all levels of government.  

This role is well\-suited for individuals with strong public policy experience and the ability to lead on complex, evolving issues. Areas of focus may include e\-commerce and online marketplaces, data privacy and security, artificial intelligence, biometrics, and other emerging technologies. Familiarity with competition policy and intellectual property protections is a plus. Candidates with backgrounds in these or related policy domains — and the ability to rapidly gain fluency in new issue areas and translate complex topics into actionable strategies — are encouraged to apply.  

Walmart’s Global Public Policy (GPP) team is responsible for identifying risks and opportunities in the public policy space with the goals of maintaining and expanding the company’s license to operate; creating opportunity for our 2\.1 million associates; serving millions of customers across the globe; and building shared value in the communities we serve.  

  

Responsibilities
  

The Policy Director provides leadership in defined public policy areas that are of strategic interest to Walmart and its stakeholders. Using subject matter expertise and serving as a counselor to the business, the role engages in complex public policy analysis and works with a range of internal and external stakeholders to shape strategic priorities.  

The Policy Director must think critically and act decisively. The role also requires the flexibility to shift focus on a multitude of issues that could – from one day to the next – affect local communities, or have national or global scope. Effective communication to colleagues, business partners, policymakers, and the general public, working closely with Walmart’s government affairs and communications teams, is paramount.  

Come to this role with a strong background in public policy and a desire to grow within a dynamic team. Expect to operate independently and collaboratively. Commit to thinking practically and creatively. Be willing to communicate and execute with urgency, and demonstrate sound judgement while doing so.**What you'll do...**
---------------------

* Identify Walmart’s public policy priorities, both within your area(s) of subject matter expertise and through collaboration in peer\-owned areas.
* Devise appropriate strategic plans to address Walmart’s public policy priorities, and work with colleagues to execute effective tactics.
* Inform, advise, and recommend appropriate courses of action to internal business partners regarding Walmart’s public policy priorities.
* Monitor and analyze legislation, high\-level administrative or regulatory activity, and other government\-led initiatives at all levels that could potentially impact Walmart, its associates, or its customers.
* Build and manage relationships with external trade and industry associations, NGOs, public policy experts, subject matter experts, and other stakeholders.
* Leverage stakeholder relationships in the public policy space to advance Walmart’s policy priorities and promote a better understanding of Walmart’s important role in society.
* Engage in public policy research with internal and external partners.
* Build networks across internal business functions to develop accurate and meaningful public policy positions, and oversee appropriate responses to external factors.


  

What you’ll bring:
* You have 8\+ years’ applied public policy experience and demonstrated success in government affairs, and/or related advocacy fields; corporate experience in this capacity is a plus
* You hold a Bachelor’s degree in government/political science, economics, international affairs, business, or relevant subject matter fields (see above)
* You have a deep understanding of policymaking processes at the state/local, federal, and/or global level – and how to leverage private sector influence in those processes
* You want to tackle complex public policy problems, and can anticipate them and react quickly when they occur
* You can identify appropriate courses of action in response to complex public policy problems, and then work with teams to implement effective solutions
* You are comfortable directly counseling senior leaders on policy issues and strategy
* You have experience in working in matrixed environments with an ability to navigate complex organizations and spark collaboration across teams and departments
* You have experience cultivating and managing stakeholder relationships with trust and integrity

Walmart.title: (USA) Staff, Technical Program Manager - AI Enablement
Walmart.description:
**Position Summary...**
-----------------------

**What you'll do...**
---------------------


Walmart’s Enterprise Business Services (EBS) is a powerhouse of seven exceptional teams delivering world\-class technology solutions and services making a profound impact at every level of Walmart. As a key part of Walmart Global Tech, our teams set the bar for operational excellence and leverage emerging technology to support millions of customers, associates, and stakeholders worldwide. Joining EBS means embarking on a journey of limitless growth, relentless innovation, and the chance to set new industry standards that shape the future of Walmart. **Role summary:** The Staff TPM \- AI Enablement is a hybrid leader and builder who operates at the intersection of **technology, strategy, and innovation**. This role goes beyond traditional program management — blending the disciplines of technical design, product strategy, and hands\-on prototyping to drive AI transformation. You will serve as both **strategist** and **practitioner**: helping the business understand the art of the possible with AI, championing adoption. You will act as a **technical generalist** and **thought partner,** wearing multiple hats as needed — **vibe coder, technical designer, program leader, and product thinker** — to accelerate adoption and deliver meaningful business outcomes.
  

**About the team:** The team leverages AI, platforms, and data to develop secure, compliant, and user\-centric solutions that support Walmart’s Corporate Affairs. Their initiatives include automating ESG disclosure, sustainability, and philanthropy impact reporting, while enhancing global newsroom operations and stakeholder engagement tools. By responsibly applying AI and advanced data science techniques, the team improves operational efficiency, accuracy, and reach. Collaboration and leadership drive continuous innovation, ensuring solutions align with business goals and enable trusted, data\-driven decision\-making across complex programs and technical designs.
  

**What you'll do:** **AI Strategy \& Enablement:** Partner with business and tech to identify where AI can drive measurable impact. Translate emerging AI capabilities into actionable strategies. **Program Leadership:** Identify and prioritize high\-impact opportunities, build business cases. Define clear goals, drive alignment, and manage dependencies to ensure scalable and sustainable outcomes. **Prototyping \& Technical Execution:** Independently build and iterate on AI\-driven solutions that validate hypotheses and inform investments, collaborating with Engg and DS as needed. **Product Thinking:** Shape problem statements, define success metrics, and craft roadmaps that balance innovation with business value.
  

**What you'll bring:** A strong mix of **technical depth, strategic vision, and executional excellence**. Proven experience leading complex, cross\-functional technology programs. Ability to understand and apply AI/ML concepts, design systems, and prototype solutions. Strong product mindset with experience developing business cases and driving adoption. Exceptional communication and influence skills to align stakeholders across functions. Comfort operating in ambiguity with an entrepreneurial, hands\-on approach. Passion for emerging technologies, a builder’s mindset, and a drive to make AI accessible and impactful across the organization.
  

  

**About Walmart Global Tech**  

Imagine working in an environment where one line of code can make life easier for hundreds of millions of people. That’s what we do at Walmart Global Tech. We’re a team of software engineers, data scientists, cybersecurity expert's and service professionals within the world’s leading retailer who make an epic impact and are at the forefront of the next retail disruption. People are why we innovate, and people power our innovations. We are people\-led and tech\-empowered. We train our team in the skillsets of the future and bring in experts like you to help us grow. We have roles for those chasing their first opportunity as well as those looking for the opportunity that will define their career. Here, you can kickstart a great career in tech, gain new skills and experience for virtually every industry, or leverage your expertise to innovate at scale, impact millions and reimagine the future of retail.  

  

Walmart’s culture is a competitive advantage, and it’s fostered by being together. Working together in person allows us to collaborate, align quickly and innovate with greater speed. We use our campuses to create purposeful connection rooted in deepening understanding and investing in the development of our associates.  

  

Our hubs: Walmart is a global company with offices across the United States and around the world. Our global headquarters is in Bentonville, Arkansas, with primary hubs in the San Francisco Bay area and New York/New Jersey.  

  

**Benefits:**  

Benefits: Beyond our great compensation package, you can receive incentive awards for your performance. Other great perks include 401(k) match, stock purchase plan, paid maternity and parental leave, PTO, multiple health plans, and much more.  

  

**Equal Opportunity Employer:**  

Walmart, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer – By Choice. We believe we are best equipped to help our associates, customers, and the communities we serve live better when we really know them. That means understanding, respecting, and valuing unique styles, experiences, identities, ideas, and opinions – while allowing for belonging for all people.  

  

*The above information has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed in the role. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all responsibilities and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job. The full Job Description can be made available as part of the hiring process.*  

 At Walmart, we offer competitive pay as well as performance\-based bonus awards and other great benefits for a happier mind, body, and wallet. Health benefits include medical, vision and dental coverage. Financial benefits include 401(k), stock purchase and company\-paid life insurance. Paid time off benefits include PTO (including sick leave), parental leave, family care leave, bereavement, jury duty, and voting. Other benefits include short\-term and long\-term disability, company discounts, Military Leave Pay, adoption and surrogacy expense reimbursement, and more. You will also receive PTO and/or PPTO that can be used for vacation, sick leave, holidays, or other purposes. The amount you receive depends on your job classification and length of employment. It will meet or exceed the requirements of paid sick leave laws, where applicable. For information about PTO, see https://one.walmart.com/notices. Live Better U is a Walmart\-paid education benefit program for full\-time and part\-time associates in Walmart and Sam's Club facilities. Programs range from high school completion to bachelor's degrees, including English Language Learning and short\-form certificates. Tuition, books, and fees are completely paid for by Walmart.
  

Eligibility requirements apply to some benefits and may depend on your job classification and length of employment. Benefits are subject to change and may be subject to a specific plan or program terms.
  

For information about benefits and eligibility, see One.Walmart.
  

The annual salary range for this position is $110,000\.00 \- $220,000\.00 Additional compensation includes annual or quarterly performance bonuses. Additional compensation for certain positions may also include :
  

* Stock

* Option 2: 7 years’ experience in engineering, engineering program management, technical program management, product management, or related area.

Passion for emerging technologies, a builder’s mindset, and a drive to make AI accessible and impactful across the organization.
  

  

**About Walmart Global Tech**  

Imagine working in an environment where one line of code can make life easier for hundreds of millions of people. That’s what we do at Walmart Global Tech. We’re a team of software engineers, data scientists, cybersecurity expert's and service professionals within the world’s leading retailer who make an epic impact and are at the forefront of the next retail disruption. People are why we innovate, and people power our innovations. We are people\-led and tech\-empowered. We train our team in the skillsets of the future and bring in experts like you to help us grow. We have roles for those chasing their first opportunity as well as those looking for the opportunity that will define their career. Here, you can kickstart a great career in tech, gain new skills and experience for virtually every industry, or leverage your expertise to innovate at scale, impact millions and reimagine the future of retail.  

  

Walmart’s culture is a competitive advantage, and it’s fostered by being together. Working together in person allows us to collaborate, align quickly and innovate with greater speed. We use our campuses to create purposeful connection rooted in deepening understanding and investing in the development of our associates.  

  

Our hubs: Walmart is a global company with offices across the United States and around the world. Our global headquarters is in Bentonville, Arkansas, with primary hubs in the San Francisco Bay area and New York/New Jersey.  

  

**Benefits:**  

Benefits: Beyond our great compensation package, you can receive incentive awards for your performance. Other great perks include 401(k) match, stock purchase plan, paid maternity and parental leave, PTO, multiple health plans, and much more.  

  

**Equal Opportunity Employer:**  

Walmart, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer – By Choice. We believe we are best equipped to help our associates, customers, and the communities we serve live better when we really know them. That means understanding, respecting, and valuing unique styles, experiences, identities, ideas, and opinions – while allowing for belonging for all people.

Walmart.title: (USA) Software Engineer III
Walmart.description:
**Position Summary...**
-----------------------

**What you'll do...**
---------------------

**Role summary:** As a Software Engineer III, you will lead the design, development, and maintenance of scalable software solutions that align with business and technical requirements. This role involves analyzing requirements, implementing efficient code, and ensuring high\-quality standards through rigorous testing and continuous integration practices. You will collaborate across teams to optimize performance, troubleshoot issues, and contribute to the advancement of development methodologies. Your expertise will support the delivery of reliable, secure, and maintainable applications that drive business objectives and enhance user experiences within an agile environment.
**About the team:**
-------------------


The team is dedicated to developing advanced embedded software for Smart TV platforms, focusing on seamless integration across UI, Middleware, and Hardware layers. Members collaborate to optimize video processing features, ensuring high performance and quality across diverse formats. The group embraces Agile methodologies, emphasizing rigorous testing and continuous improvement within a Behavior Driven Development framework. Experienced engineers mentor peers, fostering technical growth and knowledge sharing. The team values precision, innovation, and accountability, working collectively to deliver reliable, scalable solutions that meet business and technical requirements in a dynamic environment.
**What you'll do:**
-------------------


* Analyze and translate business and technical requirements into scalable software solutions.
* Develop, configure, and maintain code components adhering to coding standards and best practices.
* Collaborate within Agile teams to create user stories, estimate tasks, and deliver high\-quality software.
* Implement automated scripts to support continuous integration and deployment processes.
* Conduct code reviews and ensure compliance with security and quality standards.
* Identify, troubleshoot, and resolve defects and performance issues efficiently.
* Monitor application performance and contribute to maintenance and enhancement activities.
* Utilize version control and project management tools to support development lifecycle.

**What you'll bring:**
----------------------


* at least 3 years (preferably 5 years) of experience with programming languages such as C, advance C\+\+ (C\+\+ 17 or later), and Python, with strong coding standards adherence.
* Experience with Agile software development methodologies and project management practices.
* Solid understanding of software design principles, object\-oriented programming, and data structures.
* Familiarity with version control systems, including Git and GitHub.
* Ability to analyze and translate business and technical requirements into scalable, maintainable software solutions.
* Knowledge of continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD) pipelines and automation scripting.
* Competence in troubleshooting, defect management, and performance monitoring of software applications.
* Experience working with Linux environments and embedded software development.

Walmart.title: (USA) Fashion Coach
Walmart.description:
**Position Summary...**
-----------------------

**What you'll do...**
---------------------


Provides supervision and development opportunities for hourly associates by hiring, training, and mentoring of associates; assigning duties; setting clear expectations; providing associate recognition; communicating expectations consistently and effectively promoting a belonging mindset in the workplace and recruiting and developing qualified associates to meet staffing needs and achieve company growth potential. Coordinates, completes, and oversees job\-related activities and assignments by developing and maintaining relationships with key stakeholders; supporting plans and initiatives to meet customer and business needs; identifying and communicating goals and objectives; building accountability for and measuring progress in achieving results; identifying and addressing improvement opportunities; and demonstrating adaptability and promoting continuous learning. Leads and develops teams effectively by teaching, training, and actively listening to associates; touring stores and providing feedback (Tour\-to Teach); communicating and collaborating with all levels of associates regarding store operations, utilizing technology, business initiatives, merchandising, and company direction; introducing and leading company change efforts; providing clear expectations and guidance to implement business solutions; and communicating business objectives to teams effectively. Provides supervision and development opportunities for associates by hiring and training; mentoring; assigning duties; providing recognition; and promoting a belonging mindset in the workplace. Models and demonstrates exceptional customer service standards to store associates by following and demonstrating the One Best Way (OBW) service model; managing and supporting customer service initiatives (for example, store of the community and community outreach programs); ensuring customer needs, complaints, and issues are successfully resolved; developing and implementing action plans to correct deficiencies; and providing process improvement leadership to ensure a high quality customer experience. Ensures compliance with company policies and procedures and supports company mission, values, and standards of ethics and integrity by implementing related action plans; utilizing and supporting the Open Door Policy; and providing direction and guidance on applying these in executing business processes and practices. Drives the financial performance and sales of the designated store area by reviewing and evaluating P\&L (Profit \& Loss) statements; managing and assisting in budgeting, forecasting and controlling expenses in designated business area to confirm they are indexed to sales; monitoring and ensuring effective merchandise presentation, seasonal transitions, inventory flow, and operational processes; and developing and implementing action plans to mitigate shrink and ensure sales and profit goals are achieved for business area. Respect the Individual: Embraces differences in people, cultures, ideas, and experiences; creates a workplace where associates feel seen, supported and connected through a culture of belonging; creates opportunities for all associates to thrive and perform; helps to attract the best talent. Respect the Individual: Works as a team; builds strong and trusting relationships; communicates with impact, energy, and positivity to motivate and influence. Respect the Individual: Strengthens the team by helping, developing and mentoring others; recognizes others’ contributions and accomplishments. This platform is a multi\-tenant framework that is the single source of truth for all inventory data in Mexico, Canada, and other Walmart International sites. The team drives innovation in ensure real\-time access to accurate inventory information used throughout Walmart’s critical systems. **About Team:** Focusing on customer, associate and business needs, this team works with Walmart International, which includes more than 5,200 retail units, operating in 23 countries such as Canada, Central America, Chile, China, India, Mexico and South Africa to name a few. **What you'll do:**

Walmart.description:
**Position Summary...**
-----------------------

**What you'll do...**
---------------------


**Immigration sponsorship is not available for this role.** This is a full\-time, onsite role at our Bentonville, AR office. This position is not eligible for remote work. **About the Team** Our team partners closely with **Walmart International**, which operates more than **5,900 retail units across 26 countries** under 55 banners — including Africa, Argentina, Canada, Central America, Chile, China, India, Japan, and Mexico. We’re part of the **International and Omni Tech organization**, focused on building scalable, distributed systems that power global commerce and enhance the experience for millions of customers every day. **About the Role** We are seeking a **talented and passionate Senior Backend Engineer** to design, develop, and maintain robust microservice\-based systems that support Walmart’s global retail operations. You’ll be part of the **International Store Operations team**, responsible for maintaining and modernizing **inventory management applications** that support more than **4,000 stores across 8 countries**. You’ll play a key role in shaping our backend architecture using **Java, Spring Boot, Kafka, and SQL/NoSQL databases**, leading a team through complex challenges and delivering solutions at massive scale. **What You’ll Do**
* **Lead development efforts** for a cross\-functional agile team of 6–8 engineers responsible for critical backend features and applications used across multiple international markets.
* **Translate complex requirements** into scalable, high\-performance solutions using **Java, Spring Boot, Kafka**, and modern cloud technologies.
* **Design, build, test, deploy, and maintain** secure APIs and microservices with a focus on automation, fault tolerance, and high availability.
* **Drive code quality** through reviews, documentation, and adherence to best practices in system design, performance, and reliability.
* **Mentor and guide engineers** by sharing expertise through technical talks, code reviews, and pair programming.
* **Collaborate cross\-functionally** with product managers, architects, and global engineering teams to deliver insight\-driven, customer\-focused outcomes.
* **Analyze and optimize** application performance, monitor production systems, and lead root cause analyses to ensure stability and resilience.
* **Champion innovation** by evaluating emerging technologies and contributing to the continuous improvement of our engineering practices.


**What You’ll Bring**
* **8\+ years of experience** in software engineering, with at least **2–3 years in a technical lead capacity.**
* **Expert\-level proficiency** in **Java** and **Spring Boot**, with deep knowledge of **distributed systems** and **microservices architecture.**
* Experience with **SQL (Azure SQL)** and **NoSQL (Cosmos, Cassandra, MongoDB)** databases.
* Hands\-on experience with **Kafka**, **containerization**, and **cloud environments** (Azure, GCP, or AWS).
* Strong understanding of **DevOps principles**, CI/CD pipelines, and system observability.
* Proven ability to **design for scalability, reliability, and performance** in large, complex systems.
* Familiarity with **application security**, **test automation**, and **behavior\-driven development.**
* Experience **guiding developers on AI adoption** within development processes and driving **AI integrations** within applications.
* Excellent **problem\-solving, collaboration, and communication skills** with a passion for mentoring others.


**You’ll Really Wow Us If You…**
* Thrive in fast\-paced environments and bring curiosity, creativity, and a drive to continuously learn.
* Are passionate about building **cloud\-native systems** that solve real\-world problems at scale.
* Enjoy mentoring others and elevating the technical capabilities of your team.
* Have experience delivering **high\-impact projects in a global, enterprise environment.**


**About Walmart Global Tech** Imagine working where one line of code can make life easier for hundreds of millions of people. That’s what we do at **Walmart Global Tech**. With over **15,000 engineers, data scientists, and service professionals**, we build innovations that improve how our customers shop and empower our 2\.3 million associates worldwide. Here, you’ll have the opportunity to **innovate at scale, impact millions, and redefine the future of retail** — all while growing your career in a culture that values curiosity, collaboration, and continuous learning.

-----------------------

---------------------


Walmart's Enterprise Business Services (EBS) is a powerhouse of seven exceptional teams delivering world\-class technology solutions and services making a profound impact at every level of Walmart. As a key part of Walmart Global Tech, our teams set the bar for operational excellence and leverage emerging technology to support millions of customers, associates, and stakeholders worldwide. Joining EBS means embarking on a journey of limitless growth, relentless innovation, and the chance to set new industry standards that shape the future of Walmart. Walmart’s Associate Listening and Relations is a full\-stack Generative AI team within the People function, dedicated to empowering over 2\.2 million associates globally through AI\-driven solutions that enhance productivity, well\-being, and a sense of belonging. The team builds advanced systems such as a RAG\-based knowledge Q\&A tool, agentic HR automation interfaces, and text\-to\-SQL analytics to streamline access to information and actions. They are seeking a Senior Software Engineer to drive observability, automation, and scalability across these systems, leveraging expertise in Python, cloud platforms, distributed systems, and MLOps to deliver robust, personalized, and scalable experiences that support Walmart’s evolving workforce needs. What you will do
* Guide and shape the direction of overall technical strategy.
* Develop and communicate clear technical vision and strategy that aligns with organizations business goals and objectives.
* Cross\-functional Collaboration: Work with product, science, and peer engineering teams to bring products to life.
* Develop Scalable and Personalized Experiences: Utilize your understanding of product requirements, GenAI technology stack, and software architecture to enhance associate experiences.
* Partner with Leaders: Collaborate with Feedback platform product and business leaders to ensure alignment and integration of ML solutions into existing software and systems.
* Manage Software Development Dependencies: Work with product, science, information security, and peer engineering teams to identify and manage dependencies effectively, ensuring streamlined development processes.
* Cloud\-Based Architectures: Leverage or build cloud\-based architectures, technologies, and platforms to deliver optimized ML models at scale.
* Model MLOps Best Practices: Implement CI/CD best practices, including test automation, automated deployments, model retraining, and monitoring to ensure the successful deployment and continuous operation of ML systems and pipelines.
* Stay Updated: Keep abreast of the latest state\-of\-the\-art techniques in machine learning applications/models and foster a culture of continuous learning within the organization.


What You'll Bring
 * 7\-10 years of experience in **architecting large scale systems** with challenges of scalability and delivering sub\-second latencies on 99\.99% uptime.
* Python Expertise: A deep understanding of Python and its principles, with the ability to apply them effectively. Python will be your primary language, with some use of JavaScript.
* Code Quality Leadership: Responsible for code reviews and setting high code quality standards for the team.
* Architectural Design Experience: Demonstrated experience in leading architecture design.
* ML Pipeline Expertise: Extensive knowledge and experience in building scalable, distributed end\-to\-end machine learning pipelines and services.
* Technical Proficiency: Highly skilled in the technologies we use and learn daily, including API Design, scaling applications, distributed systems, Python (ML, APIs, workflows), Cloud Platforms (Azure, GCP), Kubernetes, Kafka, Airflow, and SQL.
* Software Engineering Fundamentals: Strong foundation in software engineering/API design fundamentals, with the ability to write production code when needed.
* Intellectual Curiosity: A passion for GenAI, MLOps, and cloud technologies, and a desire to stay current with advancements in the field.

-----------------------

The ideal candidate will have experience as a tech lead and strong development background in Micro Service Architectures using backend technologies like Java, Spring Boot, Kafka technologies and a proven track record of delivering high\-quality scalable software applications. You will collaborate with our product team, in\-house developers, and architects to design, develop, and enhance a reliable and easy\-to\-maintain backend infrastructure. Additionally, you will be expected to play a leading role in modernizing our development solutions and patterns through AI, so hands\-on experience with relevant tech in a development capacity is a must.

Focusing on customer, associate and business needs, this team works with Walmart International, which includes more than 5,200 retail units, operating in 23 countries such as Canada, Central America, Chile, China, India, Mexico and South Africa to name a few.

* Coding standards and guidelines; Coding languages (E.g. Java, JavaScript etc.), frameworks (E.g. Spring framework etc.), Platforms (E.g. Microsoft Azure etc.); Quality, Safety and Security (PCI etc.) standards; Emerging tools and technologies; Telemetry; CI / CD; Code Management Tools; SDLC; Secure SDL frameworks and tools.

This approach helps us make quicker decisions, remove the location barriers across our global team and be more flexible in our personal lives.

Walmart.title: Staff, Software Engineer – Full Stack Me@Campus
Walmart.description:
**Position Summary...**
-----------------------

**What you'll do...**
---------------------


Join Walmart as **Staff Software Engineer – Full Stack Me@Campus** in our Global Technology EBS team. Your work could help over 240 million global customers live better every week. Yes, we are the Fortune \#1 company. But you’ll quickly find we’re a company who wants you to feel comfortable bringing your whole self to work. A career at Walmart is where the world’s most complex challenges meet a kinder way of life. Our mission spreads far beyond the walls of our stores. Join us and you'll discover why we are a world leader in belinging, sustainability, and community involvement. From day one, you’ll be empowered and equipped to do the best work of your life. Walmart’s Enterprise Business Services (EBS) is a powerhouse of seven exceptional teams delivering world\-class technology solutions and services making a profound impact at every level of Walmart. As a key part of Walmart Global Tech, our teams set the bar for operational excellence and leverage emerging technology to support millions of customers, associates, and stakeholders worldwide. Joining EBS means embarking on a journey of limitless growth, relentless innovation, and the chance to set new industry standards that shape the future of Walmart. **About the Team**
  

The Me@Campus Core teams are responsible for the centralized platforms and processes leveraged by the Me@Campus mobile and desktop applications; a single, integrated experience for our campus\-based associates. The Core Platforms team is responsible for all core services and integrations leveraged by the Me@Campus mobile and desktop core applications. This responsibility includes a wide variety of different technologies in the areas of application development, deployment, infrastructure management, observability and telemetry, performance testing, many more. **About the Role**
  

As a Staff Full Stack Engineer at Walmart, you will play a key role in architecting and delivering highly scalable and performant applications that power both customer\-facing and associate\-facing experiences. You will leverage modern frontend and backend technologies to build seamless web and mobile applications, working closely with cross\-functional teams to define technical direction, mentor engineers, and drive engineering excellence across the stack. **Key Responsibilities**
* Design and build full stack applications using React Native (mobile and web)
* Architect and implement scalable backend services and APIs (REST, GraphQL).
* Model and optimize NoSQL databases (MongoDB, DynamoDB, Couchbase, or similar) for high\-availability and large\-scale workloads.
* Drive technical design discussions, code reviews, and platform\-wide improvements.
* Ensure high standards of performance, security, accessibility, and scalability across applications.
* Partner with product managers, designers, and backend teams to deliver end\-to\-end features.
* Integrate CI/CD, automated testing, and monitoring into the development workflow.
* Mentor engineers and contribute to technical strategy for web and mobile platforms.

**Qualifications**
* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent experience.
* 8\+ years of professional software development experience, with deep expertise in full stack development.
* Advanced proficiency in React Native (iOS/Android) and React Hooks for modern frontend development.
* Strong backend development skills with experience in REST APIs and GraphQL.
* Hands\-on expertise with NoSQL databases (MongoDB, DynamoDB, or equivalent).
* Solid understanding of modern JavaScript/TypeScript and Node.js runtime.
* Experience with CI/CD pipelines, automated testing, and cloud deployments (AWS/GCP/Azure).
* Proven ability to design scalable, reliable, and maintainable solutions.

**Preferred Qualifications**
* Experience with state management libraries (Redux,, Apollo Client).
* Experience with Cypress and R2 Automation Frameworks
* Experience with Agentic AI Frameworks will be great.
* Familiarity with microservices and event\-driven architectures (Kafka, Pub/Sub).
* Knowledge of SQL databases (PostgreSQL, MySQL) alongside NoSQL systems.
* Strong understanding of caching, performance tuning, and monitoring tools.
* Contributions to open\-source frameworks or libraries.

At Walmart, we offer competitive pay as well as performance\-based bonus awards and other great benefits for a happier mind, body, and wallet. Health benefits include medical, vision and dental coverage. Financial benefits include 401(k), stock purchase and company\-paid life insurance. Paid time off benefits include PTO (including sick leave), parental leave, family care leave, bereavement, jury duty, and voting. Other benefits include short\-term and long\-term disability, company discounts, Military Leave Pay, adoption and surrogacy expense reimbursement, and more. You will also receive PTO and/or PPTO that can be used for vacation, sick leave, holidays, or other purposes. The amount you receive depends on your job classification and length of employment.
